title: Reduction in diesel export tax, China’s population declines, & more

news.title: More...
news.description:
+The govt has reduced the tax on diesel export to Rs 5 per litre from Rs 6.5. Levy on crude oil produced by domestic companies has been cut to Rs 1,900/tonne from Rs 2,100/tonne.
+China’s population started shrinking in 2022 for the first time in 60 years - it had 141 cr people at the end of 2020, 8.50 lakh lesser than the end of 2021.
+6.86 lakh Indians travelled to Singapore in 2022 - making India the second-largest tourist market for Singapore behind Indonesia.
+2022 was the fifth warmest year on record: NASA.

news.title: Word of the Day
news.description:
Settlement Cycle
Settlement cycle refers to the amount of times it takes for a buy or sell order to settle.
Say you sell stock X on Monday. Currently there is a T+2 settlement cycle which means you’ll get the full money for your sale after 2 days - on Wednesday.
From Jan 27, all Indian stocks will move to a T+1 settlement cycle.

news.title: 6 Day Course
news.description:
Theme: terms used to describe market downs
Day 2: Tuesday
Correction.
A correction is when there is a fall of more than 10% — with reference to the most recent high.
This could be anything: a share price, an index or markets as a whole, real estate prices, etc.
In corrections, this >10% fall can occur over a few days to a few months.
Corrections in stock prices and even entire markets are common.
Recent example: the markets fell more than 10% from April 2022 to June 2022 because of the Ukraine war.
‘Correction’ is often confused with ‘crash’.
There is no real definition of crash. It is a loosely used word. When a stock or markets fall suddenly, it is called a crash.

news.title: Featured Question
news.description:
"Who guides the operations of that company which have ZERO Promoter holding ,like ITC ?"

There are many companies which are majorly owned by the public.
Companies like ICICI Bank, ITC, and L&T are majorly owned by shareholders of different kinds like individual investors, mutual funds, domestic and foreign institutional investors, and so on.
There is a board in place that is constituted to benefit shareholders. This board appoints the CEO. The CEO is responsible for running the company in a manner that is best for the shareholders.
If the CEO doesn’t perform, he/she can removed by the board.
Even the world’s largest company, Apple, does not have any promotor shareholding.
Tim Cook is the CEO appointed by Apple’s board. Steve Job’s family doesn’t hold any significant stocks in the company.
